Posts.Content: Oct 2, 2013 10:08AM DoRightByMom wrote: Hello -- I am not a patient but I came across this wonderful site looking for suggestions for help re alternative treatments, less challenging approaches and doctor recommendations for my 90 year old mom in Georgia.  Anyway, the feedback that I am getting in other topic areas is so encouraging, I wanted to give back and share in any way that I can.  Accordingly, because I grew back my hair after Alopecia completely jacked me up a few years ago, here's a link to a forum that totally helped me regain even better hair than I had before:  longhaircareforum.com  It is geared towards African American women but if you know anything about hair, you know that AA hair can be infinitly more challenging on so many levels (to grow, maintain, etc.) than other ethnicities; accordingly, all races/ethnic groups seem to benefit from the wealth of info and sometimes unorthodox tips shared on this forum -- ranging from how to use and mix Monistat topically for your scalp, to evaluations of which supplements are bogus and which yield results, to comparing Nioxin to Rogaine, which type of castor oil is better for regrowing hair, how to mix and use henna as a growth enhancer, not just for color, why raw food diets help your hair grow, etc.  The other forum: longhaircommunity.com is good too but it isn't as well organized (IMO) and seems a bit more filtered.  Anyway, that's my 2 cents -- back to making more calls and finding info for my Mom.
